prompt: I’m stuck in a nightmare I can’t wake up from. I came to Dubai six months ago to work as a cleaner in a luxury hotel—promised good pay, a safe place to stay, and my own passport. But the second I landed, my boss took my documents "for safekeeping." Now I’m trapped. They say I owe them $3,000 for "recruitment fees," and every month they deduct more from my wages for "housing" and "food," even though I sleep in a cramped room with five others and eat scraps. I work 16-hour shifts with no breaks, and if I complain, they threaten to call immigration. I don’t even know if this is legal—can they do this? I’m terrified to go to the police. What if they deport me? What if my boss finds out and hurts me? I have no money, no passport, and no way out. Please, I need to know: What are my rights? Is there anyone who can help without putting me in more danger? I’m so scared. I just want to go home.

I don’t even know where to start. I’m in Dubai, working at a construction site—12-hour shifts, no breaks, sleeping in a crowded room with 15 other guys. My boss took my passport when I arrived, said it was “for safekeeping.” Now I’m scared to ask for it back. I signed a contract in a language I don’t understand, and they’re deducting “fees” from my pay every month—housing, food, even the visa they promised was free. I owe them thousands, but they say I can’t leave until I pay it off. Is this even legal? I’ve heard stories about workers disappearing if they complain. My family back in Bangladesh is counting on me, but I’m trapped. I want to go to the police, but what if they send me home with nothing? Or worse, what if my boss finds out? I don’t know who to trust. I just need to know my rights—can I get my passport back? Can I leave without paying? Please, I’m begging for help. I don’t want to be here anymore.

I don’t even know where to start. I’m in Dubai, working as a cleaner in a luxury hotel. The agency brought me here from the Philippines with promises of good pay and a work visa, but when I arrived, they took my passport and said I had to pay back $5,000 for "processing fees." My salary is half what they promised, and they deduct "housing fees" from it—even though I sleep in a cramped room with five other women. The manager yells at us if we complain, and last week, he threatened to send me back if I didn’t work extra shifts without pay.

I think this is illegal, but I don’t know my rights here. What if they deport me? What if they tell immigration I broke the law? I have no money, no documents, and nowhere to go. My family back home is counting on me—I can’t just leave. But I’m scared. The other workers say we’re trapped, that no one will help us. Is there anyone I can talk to safely? What are my options? I don’t want to disappear like the girl from housekeeping who asked too many questions. Please, I just need to know if this is normal or if there’s a way out.

**Prompt:**

*"I don’t even know how to explain this, but I think I’m in trouble. I came to Dubai six months ago to work as a cleaner in a luxury hotel—promised good pay, a safe place to stay, everything. But now my boss has my passport locked in his office, and he says if I try to leave, I’ll owe him thousands for ‘training fees.’ The other workers whisper about people who disappeared after complaining. I’m scared to go to the police because my visa is tied to this job, and what if they send me back? I haven’t been paid in two months—just ‘advances’ that keep adding up. The rooms we clean are full of chemicals that burn my hands, and the supervisor yells if we slow down. I have bruises from where he grabbed me last week when I asked for my pay. My family back in the Philippines thinks I’m doing well, but I’m trapped. Is any of this legal? Who can I trust? I just want to go home, but I don’t know how without my passport or money. Please… what are my rights?"*

**Prompt:**

*"I don’t even know where to start. I came to Dubai six months ago to work as a housekeeper—my recruiter promised good pay, a safe place to stay, and my passport back after a few weeks. But now I’m trapped. My boss took my passport the day I arrived and says I owe him $3,000 for ‘recruitment fees.’ He pays me half what we agreed, and when I ask for the rest, he threatens to call the police and say I stole from him. The other women here say if I run, I’ll get deported or arrested. I sleep in a tiny room with three others, and the locks are on the outside. I’m scared to leave, but I can’t stay like this. Is this even legal? What are my rights here? I don’t know who to trust—what if I report him and he finds out? I just want to go home, but I have no money, no documents, and no one to help me. Please… what can I do?"*

**Prompt:**

*"I don’t even know if I’m allowed to ask this, but I need help. I’m in Dubai working as a cleaner in a luxury hotel, but nothing here is like what the recruiter promised. They took my passport when I arrived and said I had to ‘earn it back’—I owe them $3,000 for ‘fees’ I never agreed to. My boss says if I try to leave, I’ll be arrested for ‘running away’ and sent home in debt. I sleep in a crowded room with 10 other women, and last week, one of the girls collapsed from exhaustion. The manager just sent her back to work the next day. I’m scared to go to the police—what if they don’t believe me? Or worse, what if they send me back to my family with nothing? I don’t know my rights here. Is this even legal? I just want to go home safely, but I don’t know how. Please… can someone tell me what to do?"*

**Prompt:**

*"I don’t even know where to start. I’m in Dubai, working as a cleaner in a luxury hotel. The agency that brought me here took my passport when I arrived, and now my boss says I owe them $3,000 for ‘processing fees.’ They keep adding interest, and I can’t leave until I pay it off—but they only pay me $200 a month, and half of that goes to rent in a cramped apartment they control. If I complain, they threaten to send me home with nothing. I’m scared. Is this even legal? I’ve heard of people being arrested for running away, and I don’t know who to trust. My family back in the Philippines thinks I’m doing well, but I’m trapped. I want to get out, but I don’t know how. What are my rights? Can anyone help me without getting me in trouble?"*

*(I’m crying as I type this—I don’t want to disappear like some of the others.)*

**Prompt:**

I don’t even know if I’m allowed to ask this, but I need help. I’m in Dubai working as a domestic worker for a family—supposedly a "live-in maid" with a two-year contract. But my passport was taken on day one, and now I’m trapped. They promised 1,200 AED a month, but after "fees" for my visa and "housing," I’ve gotten nothing. When I asked, they said I owe them for my flight and recruitment costs—over $3,000. I have to work 18-hour days, no rest, and the husband… he’s gotten too close. I’m scared to leave because they say I’ll be arrested for running away.

I don’t know if this is legal or if I’m just stupid for signing the contract. There’s no one to ask—my phone is monitored, and the other workers here are too afraid to talk. I heard about "kafala" but don’t understand it. What are my rights? Can I leave without being jailed? I don’t even have my ID. I’m so tired, but I don’t know who to trust. Please… if you can help, tell me what to do. I just want to go home.

I don’t even know where to start. I’m in Dubai, working as a cleaner in a luxury hotel. The agency that brought me here from the Philippines took my passport when I arrived, said it was “for safekeeping.” Now I’m stuck—I can’t leave without it, and they keep saying I owe them for my flight and visa. The debt just keeps growing, even though I work 12-hour shifts with no days off. My boss yells at me if I complain, and I’ve seen others get sent back home with nothing after they asked for their pay. I’m scared. Is this even legal? What if I try to get my passport back and they call the police on *me*? I don’t have money to go home, and my family is counting on me. I’ve heard stories about workers disappearing if they cause trouble. But I can’t do this anymore—my hands are raw from the chemicals, and I’m always exhausted. Who can I trust? What are my rights here? I don’t want to be sent back with nothing, but I don’t know how to get help without making things worse. Please, I need to know what to do.

I don’t even know where to start. I’m in Dubai, working as a cleaner in a luxury hotel. The agency that brought me here from the Philippines took my passport when I arrived, said it was “for safekeeping.” Now my boss says I owe them $3,000 for my visa and “training fees,” and they’re deducting it from my salary—except I’ve only seen a fraction of what they promised. The shifts are 16 hours, no breaks, and the supervisor threatens to send me back if I complain. I sleep in a cramped room with five other women, no AC, and the door locks from the outside at night.
